news politics keir-starmer-says-photo-him-"Boris Johnson ‘broke the law’ claims Keir StarmerByDan BloomOnline Political Editor:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | commentsKeir Starmer has defended himself over a photo of him holding a beer which Tory critics have highlighted to accuse him of hypocrisy.The photo, first published in May , showed the Labour leader on April  that year in the run-up to the Hartlepool by-election.He was filmed through the window of Durham MP Mary Foy’s constituency office, holding a bottle while chatting with a woman, believed to be Ms Foy.Labour has previously insisted no rules were broken. Sir Keir was grilled over the photo by the BBC after the Daily Mail put it on its front page.He insisted there was “absolutely no comparison” between the photo, taken in April , and Downing Street’s “industrial” scale partying dating back to May . Sir Keir said: “I was in a constituency office days before the election, we were very busy, we were working, at some time some food turned up.  “We stopped, we had our food and then we carried on working. That is not a breach of the rules, it’s not a party and it’s no comparison to the Prime Minister.” At the time fo the photo England was in Step  of its lockdown roadmap - which banned indoor socialising with people not in your support bubble. Yet Sir Keir insisted: It was perfectly lawful to meet for work, which is what we were doing. “The party that was put to the Prime Minister on Wednesday happened because an invitation was sent to  people saying aposletaposs have some socially distant drinks in the garden and bring your own boozeapos. “There is simply no comparison.  BBC host Sophie Raworth quoted government guidance which said meetings in-person should be avoided where possible, and “there should not be any sharing of food and drink by staff who do not share a household.” The latter part of that guidance was for “staff canteens and restaurants” in which staff were eating, rather than prohibiting food completely.She asked Sir Keir “why is that any dferent ” from a photo of Boris Johnson and aides having wine and cheese in the No garden, which the PM also claimed was a work meeting.The wine and cheese gathering was on  May . Sir Keir’s photo was taken in April . Lockdown rules existed at both times though at dferent levels of severity. Sir Keir said: “If you’re trying to persuade anyone that stopping to have some food when you’re in the office all day working is a breach of the rules, it’s just not going to wash. “It shows just how far the Conservatives are sinking that they’re trying to pretend there’s some sort of comparison between this and the industrial scale partying the Prime Minister has been up to.” Asked where he draws the line, the Labour leader replied: “The line is drawn in the rules - and the Prime Minister broke the rules”. During the interview, Sir Keir reiterated that Boris Johnson must resign in the national interest as he has lost all authority in the country. When asked about Plan B measures, the Labour leader insisted it is important they are lted because the medical science says they should be lted and not because the Prime Minister is in a real mess. title: tories hint bbc licence fee
story: Anger as Tories set to axe BBC licence fee from  - and freeze £ bill for two yearsBBC chiefs will have to find billions in cutsthe £-a-year levy is frozen - while Culture Secretary Nadine Dorries said the announcement on the licence fee up to  will be the lastTV licences could be a thing of the past by the end of this decade Image: Getty ImagesByBen GlazeDeputy Political Editor:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | commentsThe BBC licence fee will be frozen for two years - forcing the corporation to make even more cuts, it was claimed today.The threat comes amid mounting Tory anger at what some MPs see as “ BBC bias”, and as the Conservatives intensy the “culture wars”.Meanwhile Culture Secretary Nadine Dorries warned the corporation the next licence fee settlement - which will take it to the end of  - “will be the last” .It comes amid mounting questions about how it should be funded compared with streaming channels like Amazon and Netflix and subscription stations like Sky Sports.She tweeted: “This licence fee announcement will be the last. The days of the elderly being threatened with prison sentences and bailfs knocking on doors are over.  Time now to discuss and debate new ways of funding, supporting and selling great British content. Shadow Culture Secretary Lucy Powell said: “The cat is out of the bag. The Prime Minister thinks those reporting on his rule breaking should pay consequences, whilst he gets off free. The Prime Minister and the Culture Secretary seem hell-bent on attacking this great British institution because they don’t like its journalism.” Lib Dem MP Jamie Stone added: “This latest Tory attack on the BBC threatens to destroy a service which is respected around the world for its high quality content. “Freezing the license fee represents a stealth cut of almost £billion that will put services, including local radio stations and childrenaposs programming, at risk. “What’s worse, there is no clarity about the future and threadbare funding will only further chip away at our cherished national broadcaster. “The Government must stop this reckless ideological crusade and back off our BBC.” The licence fee is set by the Government, which announced in  that it would rise in line with inflation for five years from April . The current cost of £-a-year is likely to remain for the next two years, according to reports. But with inflation running at .%, it means Auntie would have to slash staff or programming to deal with the real-terms funding cut. If the licence fee rose with inflation, the cost would be £. After two years at the same rate, it would have hit £.  “aposThere will be a lot of anguished noises about how it will hit popular programmes, but they can learn to cut waste like any other business,” an ally of Ms Dorries told the Mail on Sunday. “This will be the last BBC licence fee negotiation ever. “Work will start next week on a mid-term review to replace the Charter with a new funding formula. Itaposs over for the BBC as they know it.” A BBC source said: “There has been similar speculation before. “There are very good reasons for investing in what the BBC can do for the British public, and the creative industries and the UK around the world. “Anything less than inflation would put unacceptable pressure on the BBC finances after years of cuts.” A Culture Department source said licence fee discussions were ongoing, and claimed Ms Dorries “recognised pressure on peopleaposs wallets”.Read More They added: “The licence fee is an important bill for people on low incomes pensioners and one the Government can directly control.” The Tories have been heavily criticised for betraying over-s who received free TV licences. The party pledged at the  election to maintain the benefit for the rest of that Parliament, which was due to run for five years. But the BBC had already been handed responsibility for funding the concession from summer , under a deal agreed in . The corporation introduced means-testing after warning that keeping licences free for all over-s would cost £million by -. Only over-s who receive pension credit have been eligible for free licences since August . An estimated . million have to pay. The Mirror is campaigning to restore free licences for the over-s. title: uk to scrap arrival covid
story: UK to scrap arrival Covid tests for fully vaccinated ing to BritainBrits will be able to go on half-term holidays next month without having to take Covid tests upon their- as long as they have had at least two shots of vaccineCovid tests will not be required for the fully vaccinated arriving in the UK, according to reports Image: PAByTom Davidson:,  Jan | comments Vaccinated travellers will soon be allowed toto the UK without taking a Covid test, according to reports. The Sunday Times reports that Grant Shapps will scrap the arrival tests in time for the half-term holiday in February.The Transport Secretary is said to be in favour of ending the current testing regime. Travellers will have to be fully vaccinated, which is currently two jabs for adults although boosters are still recommended.An announcement has been pencilled in for January , according to The Sunday Times, which will also be when Boris Johnson will lt plan B restrictions such as working-from-home guidance. At present vaccinated travellers must take a lateral flow test two days after theyto Britain. Anyone who tests positive must isolate for ten days, although this can be cut short with a negative lateral flow test on days six and seven. source close to Shapps is said to have told The Sunday Times: We are looking at removing all Covid tests fo rvaccinated travellers by the end of January, which is likely to coincide with the review of the plan B measures onJanuary .” The change will be welcome news for the tourism industry: January is typically the busiest period for summer holiday bookings. Covid cases in the UK are plummeting, down % week-on-week however deaths remain high and hospitalisations are flat .There is optimism that the UK is through the worst of the pandemic however pressure remains very high on dozens of hospitals.Boris Johnson is clinging to his premiership after weeks of revelations about parties in Downing Street during ious stages of Covid lockdowns. news uk-news -main-symptoms-omicron-been-"Omicron: Dr Amir talks through the symptoms of the new strainByKieren WilliamsNews Reporter:,  Jan | commentsThe  main symptoms for the Omicron iant of covid have been revealed as well as how long you’re likely to have them, The ZOE Covid Study logs data from over .million public users to track information about the virus, from symptoms to where it’s most prevalent. The study encompasses the largest reporting community on Covid globally and allows the gathering of precise information about the iants.Latest information has revealed the top five symptoms logged on the app remain: a runny nose, headache, fatigue, sneezing, and a sore throat.This is a far cry from the symptoms of the alpha iant, the strain of the virus that first swept the country and had the nation fearing coughs.  Other symptoms in the top  most commonly reported included a hoarse voice, chills or shiver, brain fog, feeling dizzy, skipped meals and feeling down. This doesn’t mean there aren’t other symptoms, but these were the most widely reported on the study. On top of that, the symptoms seem to have come on faster than Delta, with a shorter incubation period too.People with the Omicron iant are likely to get them within two-to-five days after exposure.  Professor Tim Spector, who’s worked on the study, said: Over  per cent of people with a cold-like symptom have PCR proven Covid. It will be interesting to seethis changes when schools go back. It shows that the restrictions, social distancing, possibly mask wearing has had a greater effect on colds and flu than Omicron, which is even better at infecting us.  It does suggest that these symptoms are of shorter duration than they are of Delta. People are having symptoms for a shorter amount of time, especially in that first week. If people are testing negative with lateral flow tests at the end of those five days because the whole period of that infection and getting over it appears to be faster.  Top  Omicron symptoms: Headache Runny nose Fatigue Sneezing Sore throat Persistent cough Hoarse voice Other Chills or shivers Fever Dizzy Brain fog Altered smell Eye soreness Unusual muscle pains Skipped meals Loss of smell Chest pain Swollen glands Feeling down  This comes as early data seems to point towards a peak in the Omicron wave, as cases continue to fall day-on-day. The lag between catching Covid, and going to hospital, and then again to ICU means that hospitalisations continue to rise, but there is hope the country may have made it through the worst of it. A number of hospital trusts have felt the full force of the latest iant with dozens declaring critical incidents. As the country has grappled with Covid, revelations continue to spill out about an increasing number of Downing Street parties held throughout the pandemic. news uk-news brave-jogger-ashling-murphy--"Ashling Murphy: Vigils held across island of IrelandByKelly-Ann MillsNews Reporter:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | commentsBrave Ashling Murphy may be able to identy her murderer beyond the grave after bravely fighting for her le and securing vital DNA evidence. The -year-old music teacher was killed as she went jogging along a canal, but detectives say she could help bring down her attacker. The Gardai in Ireland confirmed they have the killer’s DNA after she fought for her le him the brutal attack in Tullamore on Wednesday afternoon. And that DNA evidence will be crucial in linking her attacker to the shocking murder. “Her attempts to defend herself resulted in us having the attacker’s DNA. She fought him. That will be crucial,” a source said. And as gardai focus on a new suspect who was being treated in a hospital in the east of the country yesterday, sources also confirmed that detectives have secured DNA and fingerprint evidence from the bicycle that they believe is connected to the killing. The Falcon bike was recovered by gardai in Tullamore shortly after Ashline was strangled and has now been forensically examined. Gardai say they have made signicant progress and sources believe they are close to making a breakthrough in the coming days.  Although there has been no fresh arrest in the massive murder investigation, sources have confirmed a suspect has been identied. More than  hours after the killing a man handed himself in to a hospital in the east of the country some distance from where Durrow National School first class teacher Ashling was murdered. Vigils have been held today across Ireland and in London to pay tribute to the young teacher who lost her le. title: horrific conditions dogs kept man
story: Horric conditions dogs kept in as man banned from owning them for leBoth pets owned by Michael Martin could have died without medical treatment, the RSPCA said after they searched his Grimsby homeBoth dogs found needed urgent medical care Image: RSPCAByPeter CraigTom Davidson:,  Jan | comments A man has been banned for le from keeping dogs after RSPCA officers found two dogs living in appalling conditions.Both pets owned by Michael Martin could have died without medical treatment.The -year-old , of Grimsby, was found guilty of causing unnecessary suffering to English Bull Terrier Bella and Spike and American Bulldog cross, reports Grimsby Live. Both needed urgent veterinary care and Bella needed her long nails trimming as she struggled to walk. At Grimsby Magistrates’ Court, Martin was convicted following a trial in his absence of causing unnecessary suffering to an English Bull terrier type dog called Bella by failing to provide the necessary veterinary care and attention for her skin condition and for failing to provide the necessary care and attention for her ingrowing nails.  He also caused unnecessary suffering to an American Bulldog cross called Spike for failing to provide veterinary care and attention for his ear infection. He had denied four offences, including three of causing unnecessary suffering to his pet dogs by not getting them the medical treatment. they needed. He faced a further charge of not providing a suitable environment. Martin was banned for le from keeping any pets.  He was sentenced to  hours unpaid work as part of a  month community order and disqualied from keeping all domestic pets for le. He was also ordered to pay £ court costs and a £ victim surcharge. Inspectors found a cage in the flat in Eleanor Street, with old, dirty rags for bedding. Both the dogs were removed from the home due to concerns for their welfare. Prosecuting, Rachel Taylor said how Bella had a skin condition and her skin was red and sore looking with patches of fur loss on her legs, body and face. She was also slightly underweight. Her nails had been cut by a vet following her removal as they were curling round and had been protruding back into her pads making it very dficult for her to walk. Spike was very active and friendly but slightly overweight.  He had been prescribed medication for an infection in his ears upon examination by a vet, following his removal.The prosecutor said the dogs were being kept in an East Marsh flat that was untidy, dirty and a vet report stated it was completely unsuitable for these animals to be housed in.They were discovered in the appalling conditions on September , . The dogs were signed over into the care of the RSPCA and have since been rehomed to new families. In mitigation the defendant said he did not have time to look after the dogs due to work and had been let down by friends. title: i am trying move years
story: I am trying to move on from years of abuse by my so-called family but I dont know howA reader writes to Coleen Nolan for advice on how to move on from a dficult childhood and make  a fresh start - but doesnt know where to startA concerned reader wants to move on from his pastImage: Getty ImagesopinionByColeen Nolan:,  Jan Dear Coleen From birth, my family physically and mentally abused me. I was severely neglected. According to my records, it was the worst case of child abuse my social worker had ever seen, yet social services ed me to “my family” and no one checked up on me. My brother ganged up with his friends to make my le hell, yet my parents adored him. I was often left out of family events. I was even left alone with no food one Christmas Day while they went to a restaurant with the money I’d saved to buy myself some glasses. But I worked hard and persuaded my company to sponsor me to study for a degree. I now earn good money, but my family hate me for it and I’m seen as a “snob”. I’d never been loved or looked after, so I fell into the path of an extreme narcissist. She love-bombed me, married me quickly, stole my money and then, after several affairs, left me for a guy half her age. She left my son with me and I’ve loved and cared for him alone for years. He’s grown up now and is engaged, and I’m very proud of how well he’s done. I’ve tried to go out and meet people, but my inner child gives me a regular kicking. The only people I tend to meet are users – here today, gone tomorrow. I do want this year to be a new start for me. I want to fill my le with good people and things I enjoy. I have this blank canvas, but don’t know where to start. My friends say they can’t believe I’m so kind and that I’ve achieved what I have. I’d appreciate any advice you can give.What would you tell this reader to do  Have your say in the comment section Coleen says Counselling is my first suggestion – you need to get all this out, all the hatred, all the anger, all the sadness. That should be your start. You need to totally cut your family out of your le too – they don’t deserve you. I think you’re attracting the wrong people because you’re so desperate for love and affection. So, I’m going to reassure you – you’re one of the bravest people who’s written to me and you should be proud of what you’ve achieved against all the odds.You’ve brought up a gorgeous boy and given him the tools to succeed. You need to start believing what your friends are telling you and believe that the abuse from your family wasn’tyour fault.Please find a good therapist and don’t give up on it. If you’re not getting anywhere with one therapist, try a dferent one. You’re still questioning yourself, still asking why you received this treatment and why you weren’t loved, but it has nothing to do with you and everything to do with them. They are angry, damaged people.When you start loving yourself, you’ll be ready to let someone in who’s right for you. Your ex-we was able to take advantage because you felt itwas normal and that it was all you deserved. You deserve all the good things and all the good people.Wishing you all the luck in the world for your future. title: i made redundant went labour
story: I was made redundant as I went into labour with twins - then I lost everything in fire and floodSingle mum-of-three Carly Breslin, , was made redundant from her job of  years as she went into labour with her twins - but her bad luck continued when her flat in Islington, north London flooded and then caught on fire on Christmas EveSingle mum-of-three Carly Breslin, , was made redundant as she went into labour with twins Image: Carly Breslin   SWNSByGeorgia LambertRyan FaheyNews Reporter:,  Jan | comments A mum made redundant as she went into labour with twins became homeless when her flat flooded - then lost all her belongings in a house fire. When single mum-of-three Carly Breslin was made redundant from her job of  years as she went into labour with twins, she thought that thing couldnapost get any worse.But seven months later as she cared for her five children her family had to be rehoused in a hotel when her flat flooded following heavy rain, leaving them homeless. What she could salvage she stored in a dferent part of the property away from the water damage, along with her kidsapos Christmas presents.But as the family waited to be rehoused from the two rooms of their hotel, their old flat caught fire on Christmas Eve, destroying the little they had left along with the presents.When reliving her ordeal, the -year-old said: I canapost tell you how stressed Iaposve been - too much has happened that I canapost begin to make sense of it all, itaposs just been terrible.Carly and her kids aged , seven, three and newborn lived on the top floor of a new build in Islington north London until the extreme weather turned their lives upside down. The former art director for Toni and Guy, said: In July, we had the flash floods and there must have been a lot of rain which was just building up on the roof. It started off trickling down one of the light fittings and it took about three weeks for it to be pouring out of everywhere. We were told by surveyors that it was unsafe to live there anymore, so the council put us in a hotel and at first I was like aposoh my god, I canapost live like that, I have babies to look afterapos and at that time I thought even a night would be too much. But weaposve been there for six months now.  While waiting to be rehoused, Carly and her five children have been living in two rooms at the hotel in Angel, just a mile away from their family home. Her mum Tracie, who chose to set up a heartfelt GoFundMe page to help her daughter face the financial burden, said: As you can imagine, living in hotel rooms with a -year-old, seven-year-old, a three-year-old, and seven-month-old twins has been very challenging. With the hope of keeping the festive spirit alive in the run-up to Christmas, Carly was looking forward to spending the day with her family. However, come Christmas Eve morning at around  am a fire broke out and ripped through what was left of the family home.  As Carly recalled: It was around  am on Christmas morning when I woke up to lots of missed calls from two of my old neighbours who told me the flat was on fire and I just couldnapost believe it. Everyone had been evacuated but we just couldnapost work out what had caught alight. From the flooding, there was mould growing on what was left of the furniture, so we had put everything we couldaposve saved in boxes in the kitchen and the living room, where it was safe, but thataposs where the fire happened. Because my kids still believe in Santa, I decided to hide their presents in the flat because I wanted them to be surprised and have a nice day. The presents had been ruined by the fire, and of the ones we managed to save, they smelt of smoke and were covered in black soot. My little girl said that aposFather Christmas had gone down lots of chimneysapos because she could smell the smoke, so I went with that story because I didnapost want to worry them.  Carly explained that she decided to try and make the best out of the worst situation but is worried about how she might come across. She said: I was so overwhelmed at what had happened and itaposs so upsetting to see all your stuff ruined. Any other day wouldaposve been easier for me to handle, but it was Christmas and all I wanted was for them to have a nice day after going through so much upset, so making it special was quite important for me. Iaposve tried to keep things away from them as much as possible and they did end up really enjoying the day, despite what happened. I had to go away to wipe my tears and come back pretending I was okay. I donapost want to be seen as some sort of charity case but we did lose everything and my mum set up the fundraising page to help us rebuild the things we lost. The family is still unsure what caused the fire and is waiting for an investigation to take place.Writing on the GoFundMe page, Tracie said: Carly was devasted when she saw the damage to everything she owned,it wasn’t burnt or melted it had smoke damage.Many have suggested to set this page up which at first we didn’t want to do butwe could at least try and get a little bit of help it would go a long way for Carly and the children. They have been through so much this year they deserve a little help. So, I am asking youyou could help restore my daughteraposs broken heart. We are all so grateful for all your support at this unbearable time. All your messages have meant so much and have filled our hearts! title: man who lost mum dad
story: Man who lost mum, dad AND brother to Covid tortured by online anti-vax trollsFramcis Goncalves lost his brother, Shaul, , dad, Basil, , and mum Charmagne, , after they began feeling ill following eating together in summer Francis Goncalves lost his mother, father and brother Image: Mark LewisByLucy JohnGraeme Murray:,  Jan | commentsOnline Covid trolls tortured a man who lost his mum, dad and brother to the virus. Francis Goncalves, lost his relations in two weeks of them feeling unwell. His brother, Shaul, , dad, Basil, , and mum Charmagne, , began feeling ill after having food together the weekend of July , . But within two weeks of their symptoms starting, the three members of his family had all passed away.They were all buried next to each other at a Covid cemetery in Portugal on August , Wales Online reports. His family did not get their coronavirus vaccines because they had been frightened by anti-vaccination misinformation. Francis, , said le hadnapost been easy since losing his family and felt the news of Boris Johnsonaposs party was disrespectful to everyone. He also spoke about the overwhelming abuse he endured from anti-vaxxer activists which only added to his ordeal. Speaking about how heaposs coped with his grief, Francis said: Itaposs not just one birthday you miss, itaposs all the birthdays, the Fatheraposs Days, the Motheraposs Days, all those celebrations and the phone calls. Now thataposs all gone and thereaposs no way you can substitute it. I do have my we who has been really supportive and close friends who have been amazing as well, but it hasnapost been easy. You donapost always feel the shock, part of you feels like youaposre just numb and you donapost feel anything and then you get overwhelmed with emotions. Everything from anger to hopelessness. You grow further away from that and you learn that you are the one who is still alive and you need to move on. You try to do your best to honour their memory, but it definitely has not been easy.With such a painful experience of the pandemic, Francis said he was taken aback when he heard rumours of a Downing Street party happening in May , before Boris Johnson apologised and confirmed he was there. .  If youaposre going to create a rule, stick by it, he said. It shouldnapost be a situation of aposdo what I say, not as I doapos. Itaposs not just a kick in the teeth, itaposs so unprofessional and disrespectful to everyone. Is he going to resign  Is he going to stay on  Who knowaposs whataposs going to happen, but heaposs completely undermined the entire process of trying to protect people. People are now turning around and asking aposhave you been spreading a lie apos, aposIs this all just some sort of charade apos, aposwhataposs going on apos. The rules were necessary, but there are a lot of very angry people out there. Everyone wants to see their family members and because of these restrictions, [many] lost the opportunity to see family members. Rather than actually being there and seeing what your family had been going through, you were only able to see them via a phone call or video call.  Knowing all too well how it feels to miss a loved one, Francis said over the last six months, he had been trying his best to share factual information on social media about Covid and vaccinations to help others make informed decisions about getting their jabs. He hopes it will prevent others from enduring his experience of the virus. He said not only is the natural grieving process painful, but on top of that having to deal with the legalities and logistics of losing someone is equally hard. Amongst dealing with all the emotions, youaposve got all legal requirements to deal with, Francis said. I have probably driven attorneys and estate agents nuts because I havenapost been in the right frame of mind and I would forget things, but theyaposve been very patient. The whole thing has cost about £, and is expected to reach £, -and thataposs not including things like real estate commissions or deposits. Thataposs just three people passing away, getting attorneys to get all the documents and to organise their funerals. The legal fees involved just add up. Then thereaposs the waiting for medical documents and receiving official causes of death, which I have done for my father and brother. I havenapost mustered up the courage to ask for my motheraposs because she was quite ill and the more ill someone is, the more complications you get with Covid.  The doctors told me what she suffered at the time and itaposs not pleasant so I canapost look at that yet. He said as expected, his brother and father officially died of pneumonia as a result of Covid. His father, who had known underlying health conditions also was confirmed to have had sepsi and unforeseen heart complications after contracting the virus, Francis said. Despite having organised most of the logistics involved with the passing of loved ones, Francis said it pained him that he could not move any of them from the mass grave into somewhere more personal at least for the foreseeable future. He said: As far as Iaposm aware thataposs where theyaposll be staying, itaposs a very dficult thought. Everyone has this romantic idea of when you pass away, youaposll be surrounded by your family, but burying someone when you have a digger right next to their graves digging up more graves is really hard. Something Francis said exacerbated his feelings over the last six months is the serious online abuse he was subjected to after he first spoke publicly about his family members dying.  There were threats from as far away as Italy, then I had private messages with all sorts of insults from people as far as Australia, he said. Literally people from all over the world. There was a lot of negativity and in the initial phases it was overwhelming. You get accused of being fake. People were looking for evidence that my family didnapost exist. Some people would send me one message and nothing , others would send me an array of messages or attack my social media feeds. Some of them got so bad I had to get the police involved. It just sort of died off. It wasnapost people who say they donapost want the vaccine because itaposs their choice, it was people who are hardcore against the vaccine and set on spreading misinformation.However, a lot of people expressed their condolences. A lot of people followed my Facebook page I set up to post information and then started making informed decisions. I wanted to give people the information they need to make that decision as opposed to listening to these blatant lies. The problem is these people are so confident and so loud and people listen to them because they expect people with that confidence to be telling the truth. Francis said his experience had left him unable to look far into the future and follow his long-term ambitions. Instead, Francis said he now just focuses on getting by at present as best he can. When you arenapost born with a large amount of money, you sometimes focus on giving your family things that you havenapost had - and my brother and I both had those goals. Iaposm now in a place where that goal is gone and I have to rebuild myself up. Who I was previously was a development of  years and most of that is based on your experience and the people you care about. I canapost think about what I want in the long-term right now. However, Francis said picking his hobbies back up which included cooking and watching movies had helped to get him back on his feet by giving him a focus. If I could give anyone advicetheyaposre suffering with grief it would be to be kind to yourself and donapost forget about yourself. You are still alive, donapost fall into the trap of hopelessness, he said. title: monster mum 31 cradles newborn
story: Monster mum, , cradles her newborn daughter days before she was shaken to deathEvil mum Sophie Nash and her partner Daniel Nolan were handed a combined -year jail term after being found guilty of causing or allowing the death of their baby Ava Grace NolanSophie Nash, , was handed an eight-year jail term for causing or allowing the death of tiny baby, Ava Grace Nolan Image: Sophie Nash  Cavendish PressLtdByAshley PembertonRyan FaheyNews Reporter:,  Jan | commentsThe evil mum of a newborn baby who died from catastrophic head injuries after having the le shaken out of her was pictured cradling the infant just nine days before her tragic death.A court found both Sophie Nash, , and her partner Daniel Nolan, , guilty of causing or allowing the death of their baby, Ava Grace Nolan, as well as two counts of causing or allowing serious injury to her and child cruelty. The wicked couple were sent down for a combined  years in prison at Preston Crown Court, where jurors heard how little Ava had the le shaken out of her.A chilling photo taken moments after Avaaposs birth shows Nash - who has autism, cerebral palsy and epilepsy - cradling the infant loosely as she stares intently into the camera. Just eight days later on August , , police were called to an address in Nelson, Lancashire to reports of an unresponsive child. Paramedics rushed the tiny baby to Royal Blackburn Hospital but she couldnapost be saved and died shortly after midnight on August .A post-mortem revealed sheaposd sustained a catastrophic head injury which was the ultimate cause of her death and likely caused by forceful shaking.But that injury was not the only abuse Ava suffered in her short le. She had a separate brain injury and a broken femur - which were thought to have been inflicted in the days prior to her death. The cruel parents were volatile and abusive and consumed with their own destructive relationship - which they put before the safety of their just-born child.Around her crib in their chaotic and squalid home, Nolan smashed glass  and Nash would snatch up Ava by her babygrow - causing her head to flop around unsupported, The Sun reports.Speaking after the sentencing, Det Ch Insp Jill Johnston from Lancashire Police, said: I am pleased that Nolan and Nash have both been jailed, particularly as both have continued to blame each other and neither has ever accepted any responsibility for the acts of violence that led to baby Avaaposs death.  Ultimately their selfish preoccupation with themselves, combined with their toxic and volatile relationship, has resulted in their baby losing her le. I would again like to thank all of the officers and staff who worked on this incredibly complex and emotive case, always with the aim of getting justice for baby Ava, as well as the witnesses who gave evidence and supported this investigation. We will continue to work hard with our partners to protect children like baby Ava from harm, to educate and support parents, but ultimately to protect and safeguard children, to be their voice and to prevent tragic cases such as this.  Preston court heard how the pair repeatedly ignored professional support from midwives and health visitors and blamed each other for Avaaposs death. Earlier this week, the prosecution told Preston Crown Court Ava didnapost stand a chance in the care of her volatile and abusive parents. Mr McLaughlin QC said the prosecution could not say which of Avaaposs parents caused her injuries, but said there is an inbuilt parental responsibility to protect a child and they did not do that. Worse still, on their watch Ava Grace Nolan sustained several non accidental, traumatic injuries. One of them caused those injuries. The prosecution says the other knew. The final injury, her le was literally shaken out of her. She really did not stand a chance. title: mum bursts tears after finding
story: Mum bursts into tears after finding preserved wedding dress has turned stale yellowMum-of-two Sarah Casson, , from Sutton Coldfield in the West Midlands, had dreams of passing the near£, Swarovski crystal-encrusted wedding dress on to her daughtersshe hadnt had two boysMum-of-two Sarah Casson, , says she had the dress preserved for the future at a local dry cleaners nearly  years ago Image: Birmingham LiveByEmily CollisRyan FaheyNews Reporter:,  Jan | comments A mum-of-two burst into tears after finding her brilliant white wedding dress has turned a stale yellow despite having spent hundreds of pounds to preserve it. Sarah Casson, , had dreams of passing down her bridal gown to her children, or to wear it for her th anniversary of being wed to husband Kevin. But Sarah says she was shocked to tears when she opened the dry cleaneraposs box for the first time since they tied the knot  years ago, Birmingham Live reports.She opened the lid to find her beautul and bespoke Swarovski crystal-encrusted silk bodice had turned a stale shade of yellow. Sarah, from Sutton Coldfield in the West Midlands, said the dress is very sentimental to me and sheaposd hoped to pass it on to her daughtersshe hadnapost had two boys. The dress isnapost something her daughter-in-laws would wear, so she planned to flog it and get something you [I] always wanted. The telecommunications client partner told Birmingham Live: Weaposre moving house so I thought Iaposll get it down from on top of the wardrobe and maybe I could sell it.  The dress is very sentimental to me. When I got married I thought I might have a daughter one day I can pass it on to or change it into a christening gown for a grandchild. But Iaposve got two sons and itaposs not something their partners would wear so my husband said why not sell it and use the money to get something youaposve always wanted. But that was why I had the preserving treatment. You pay to have it treated in a special way and wrapped in acid-free paper so in the years to come, it looks as good as new and you can pass it on. I havenapost looked at it once all these years. I thoughtI open the box, it could ruin the preservation on it.  But I opened it before Christmas and I burst into tears. The net still looks white but the bodice was yellow. Three years after their marriage in , Sarah took the pricey £, gown to a dry cleaners. Sarah recalled forking between £ to £ for the preservation treatment, but says she has lost the receipt in the many years since. When I saw the dress, I took it straight back to the dry cleaners, said Sarah. They told me that because it had been treated all that time ago, there was nothing they could do.  It wasnapost like I paid a couple of pounds to have it cleaned, I paid hundreds of pounds to preserve it. Whataposs so frustrating is Iaposve still got the veil I wore on my wedding day that I never got cleaned which is still brilliant white. My original plan was to maybe re-wear the dresswe renewed our vows for our th anniversary. Iaposm quite into my fitness so I could have worn it again, but now I donapost have that option because who wants to wear a yellow wedding dress  The dress is still in its original box, which is still in good condition, she says. A spokesperson for the dry cleaners in question told BirminghamLive: There were no identying tags on the dress to confirm it was us that did the preservation  years ago.  We package all of our wedding dresses in acid-free tissue and in an acid-free box to ensure that this doesnapost affect the colour of it, but it does require to be kept in a reasonable, stable temperature. It canapost be kept in the loft or anywhere with damp or severe changes in temperature as that can affect the preservation. When this dress was ed to us, it did not have acid-free tissue wrapped around it in the same way we package our wedding dresses and the box did look as though it had been knocked about a bit, with damp patches and water marks over it. They added: [The discolouration] will be down to the way it has been stored. title: mum jumped shopping centre to
story: Mum jumped from shopping centre to be reunited with daughter, , killed by exCherie Rangeley, , said she tried to take her le after hearing details of how her ex killed -year-old daughter Paige by deliberately starting a house fire at a home in HullCherie Rangeley said she attempted to take her own le following the death of her daughter Image: Katie PughByJames Campbell:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan A heartbroken mum was left in a coma after jumping from the second floor of a shopping centre in a bid to be reunited with her daughter.Cherie Rangeley, , said she tried to take her le after hearing details of how her ex killed -year-old daughter Paige by deliberately starting a house fire. Cherie, from Hull, had just sat through an inquest into Paigeaposs death when she attempted to take her own le, Hull Live reports.Garry Bolton locked himself and Paige inside the home as it burned, assistant coroner Ian Sprakes ruled.. They both died in the fire in the early hours of January , .  Cherie, who has struggled with alcoholism since the horrying tragedy, said she hit a low after after the inquest was adjourned in August last year. “I tried to kill myself,” Cherie said. “I jumped from the second floor of St Stephen’s and ended up in a coma for a short while. “I smashed my hip and knee as a result and I still have to use a wheel chair most of the time. “I just wanted to be with Paige. It will sound strange to some people but I felt Paige was calling me. “I had what seemed like a vision and Paige was there saying ‘come with me’. “Luckily, I survived. I know I now need to find a way to move on and stop trying to hurt myself. Cherie previously told Hull Live of her struggles to deal with what happened. “I nearly died because of all this as it tipped me over the edge,” she said back in August. I turned to drink and ended up in hospital. But I haven’t drank now for around ten months. Despite the conclusion into the inquest, Cherie has not got the answers she hoped for. “For Paige it wasn’t suicide, Garry murdered my little girl,” she said. “There is no closure really. He didn’t have to take my little girl. If you want to kill yourself then fine but he didn’t have to take Paige. “I feel numb and didn’t really get the answers I was hoping for. I’m not any nearer where I feel I’m supposed to be.  “I would have preferred a conclusion of suicide for Garry and unlawful killing for Paige rather than a narrative verdict. “But with Garry’s family there too I guess he has to see it from both sides.” Cherie, who was with Bolton for  years, also feels there was little said about Paige at the inquest. She said: “There was nothing really about Paige and how she felt. “At the end of the day Garry took his own le and that of Paige which he had no right or need to do. “Paige was cheeky but also shy. But once she got to know you there was no shutting her up! “I loved her so much and loved buying her things.” The inquest previously heard how Bolton and Cherie had twins Paige and Ethan in  through IVF treatment. Sadly, Ethan died of a heart defect aged just six months, which devastated Garry and Cherie.  Paige’s ashes have now been laid beside Ethan which makes Cherie’s visits to the graveside even more dficult. “I find it very hard visiting the grave as Paige really looked after Ethan’s headstone,” Cherie said “She would clean it every time we went there and would leave toys for Ethan. “Now she is not there to do it bit, instead, lies next to Ethan. Mr Sprakes said he believed Bolton had deliberately started the fire, with no logical explanation for the fire having been started accidentally. Fire crews had to break into the property using a saw and then discovered the two victims lying together in the bathtub. Bolton had locked the front door and made access inside dficult, the inquest heard, and no attempt had been made to contact the emergency services.  Returning a narrative conclusion to the inquest, which started back in August, Mr Sprakes referenced chilling texts sent by Paige to her grandmother before she died saying: Daddy is scaring me. Bolton had also written a note expressing self-harm, the inquest heard. During proceedings in August, Mr Sprakes mentioned text messages Bolton had sent to former partner Cherie, which he decided not to read out but said “amounted to a suicide note”. The inquest had heard how Bolton’s mental health seemed to have deteriorated, having already suffered from anxiety, low self-esteem and paranoia. Independent fire investigator Dr Will Hutchinson carried out an investigation into the blaze and he had also given evidence to the inquest. He had said it was a smouldering fire which meant it took a number of hours to develop. He also indicated such a fire would produce lethal levels of carbon monoxide almost immediately, which could take effect in a matter of minutes. The smoke alarm was also not working, but he could not say for sure whether the fire had been caused accidentally or deliberately.However, Humberside Fire and Rescue Service station manager Richard Gibson believed the cause was deliberate.He said: “I believe the ignition was due to an unspecied naked flame. “As the seat of the fire was in the centre of the bed, it leads me to believe it was deliberate.” Mr Sprakes delivered a narrative verdict. He said: “On January . , Garry Bolton and Paige Bolton died at  Wensley Avenue in Hull between approximately .am and am due to the effects of inhalation of products of combustion and carbon monoxide poisoning due to the effects of a smouldering fire probably deliberately started that morning.” The Samaritans is available  you need to talk. You can contact them for free by calling  , email jo@samaritans.org or head to the website to find your nearest branch. You matter. title: postie manages deliver letter addressed
story: Postie manages to deliver letter addressed to ‘somewhere in the Yorkshire Dales’A man was surprised when he received a letter that didnt even have his address on it, as the sender had written somewhere in the Yorkshire Dales alongside a rambling descriptionMark Dale received a letter that didnt even have his address on it Image: Ben Lack Photography LtdByJohn BettAudience Writer:,  Jan | comments A postie managed to successfully deliver a letter that was addressed to apossomewhere in the Yorkshire Dalesapos.Mark Dale had heard a recent story about Royal Mail managing to successfully deliver a letter that had no address written on it, so wanted to try it for himself. His friend, Andy Pem, volunteered to send him a recipe in the post but only included Markaposs name, and apossomewhere in the Yorkshire Dalesapos, alongside a description of him. A post-master contacted Mark after recognising his description, but he refused to share his proper address - and amazingly the letter turned up a few days later. What do you think of Royal Mail  Let us know in the comments... Taking to Facebook, Mark wrote: So, last week, I had a bit of a winge on my timeline, that the BBC were doing a big news story about how a letter got delivered with no real address.I said how Iaposd had one, years ago. Anyway, a friend, on that thread, said heaposd try it, and sent me a letter.  The letter posted to Mark was addressed: Chef Mark Dale, somewhere in the Yorkshire Dales, likes x Pajeroaposs, curly Haired lad, some top hotel chef. Mark said a postmaster saw the thread on Facebook and commented, asking for his address - but he refused. Mark continued: On that thread, a lady commented that she was from Royal Mail and they had it, could I send an address.  I said well, youaposre  per cent there, finding me, so to get my address should be easy now. And today, it arrived special delivery!Meanwhile, a man recently shared his amazement after a letter arrived at his home with a description of who he was, rather than an address.Musician Feargan Lynn had a surprise when a thin white letter popped through the letterbox with ten lines of text rather than the usual address.  Sharing the hilarious moment on Twitter, Feargal gave Royal Mail a shout out, congratulating the mail deliverer for tracking him down.“Hearty applause to @RoyalMail Cushendall and Ballymena for being able to deliver this letter to me today got a much needed laugh!” he wrote. “They had a first name, the village where I grew up and half the postcode.. the rest is more like my le story!”Do you have a story to share  Weaposd love to hear all about it. news uk-news prince-andrew-in-tears-queen-"Prince Andrew stripped of military titles and royal patronagesBySean Rayment:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan Prince Andrew was left ­tearful after being told by the Queen he was being stripped of his honorary military titles, it was claimed tonight.The Duke of York was said to be utterly devastated by his mother’s bombshell decision. It came just a fortnight after the Sunday People exclusively revealed Her Majesty would reluctantly strip her son of his prized roleshe did not resign. However Andrew, , did not bite the bullet – and will now have to write grovelling letters to his former ­regiments, it is understood. A senior defence source said: “The Prince was tearful when told the news even though he had expected it. He feels that he has let so many people down, not least his mother, during her Platinum Jubilee year.”  Our source said Andrew’s ousting had been greeted by a huge sigh of relief from armed forces top brass, who described him as “a bloody embarrassment”. The move came after a US judge ruled a civil case in New York against Andrew by his sex accuser Virginia Giuffre can go ahead. Andrew strenously denies any wrongdoing. Our insider said of the royal’s ­dramatic demotion: “He had hoped that he might get some sort of stay of execution and be allowed to clear his name before his titles were removed. “There are a number of people in the royal household who are utterly convinced that he is innocent. “But the clamour for Andrew’s scalp meant that a quick and brutal decision needed to be made.” The move, announced in a shock Palace statement on Thursday, left Andrew exiled from official royal le and facing le as a private citizen.  He was also told he will no longer be able to use the title of His Royal Highness in any official capacity. The move came after years of damaging speculation arising from Ms Giuffre’s claim she was forced to have sex with the duke three times when she was , including once in London. Andrew’s plight worsened when his former friend Ghislaine Maxwell, , was found guilty of offences relating to her work as fixer for the late billionaire paedophile Jeffrey Epstein, another Andrew associate. One senior defence source said: “Andrew is a victim of very poor decision-making. There is no way he could continue as the honorary head of distinguished military regiments. “His departure has been greeted with a huge sigh of relief. He had become a bloody embarrassment.  “He could not be present at parades, visit units or welcome troops home from operations because the story would always be about sex scandals and not about the regiments.” The duke, who had a -year active career in the Royal Navy and served as a helicopter pilot in the  Falklands war, held the honorary rank of Colonel of the Grenadier Guards. He was also Colonel-in-chief of the  th Royal Lancers, the Royal Irish Regiment, the Yorkshire Regiment, the Small Arms School Corps, and Royal Colonel of the Royal Highland Fusiliers. Plus he was Honorary Air Commodore of RAF Lossiemouth and Commodore-in-Chief of the Fleet Air Arm. Our source said Andrew is to write to each of the regiments expressing his sorrow at having to leave. “He fully maintains his innocence, but wants to apologise for the ­dficulties caused by what has happened,” the insider added. The Duke has also lost a number of overseas honorary military titles.  He was Colonel-in-Chief of the Queen’s York Rangers , the Royal Highland Fusiliers of Canada, the Princess Louise Fusiliersand Colonel-in-Chief of the Royal New Zealand Army Logistic Regiment. The defence source continued: “The big question now is who is going to fill these roles. “They all need to be filled by senior royals which means Prince Charles, who is extremely busy, Princess Anne who already has  military titles, Prince Edward or Prince William. “Honorary titles are hugely important. The role of Captain General of the Royal Marines was held by Prince Philip for  years. He knew the Royal Marines intimately. “When he handed that role over to Prince Harry his parting words were apparently ‘don’t mess it up’ because it meant so much to him.” But the Queen was reluctantly forced to strip Harry, , of the role because he chose to step down from royal duties when he moved to America with we Meghan. Today Andrew and ex-we Sarah Ferguson, , emerged in public together for the first time since he lost his honorary titles. The couple, who orced in  but remain close, looked sombre as Andrew drove them from his Royal Lodge home in Windsor Great Park. There have also been calls for Andrew to be stripped of his Duke of York title. Andrew took the name, traditionally granted to the monarch’s second son, on his marriage to Sarah in . She is still the Duchess of York. Andrew, whose helicopter acted as a decoy for Argentinian cruise missiles during the Falklands war, will also keep his Royal Navy rank of vice-admiral. title: prince andrew keep royal title
story: Prince Andrew may keep royal title despite losing military rank, expert claimsCraig Prescott, a lecturer in law at Bangor University in Wales, has shared his view on Prince Andrews current situation and how he may retain his royal titleAll of Prince Andrews military affiliations and Royal patronages have been ed to The Queen Image: REUTERSByJohn BettAudience Writer:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan Prince Andrew may keep his royal title despite losing his military rank - due to a little known law that dates back to , an expert has claimed. As the sexual abuse lawsuit against the prince develops, Buckingham Palace has issued a statement that says he will lose his remaining patronages and military titles, and he will no longer use His Royal Highness. Initially, in  after that car crash Newsnight interview with Emily Maitlis, Prince Andrewaposs duties were suspended for the foreseeable future, but now the palace has decided to remove his titles altogether, as Hull Live reports. But thanks to a law passed by King George V in , known as Letters Patent, Prince Andrew, like Prince Harry, is entitled to use the style aposHis Royal Highnessapos, unless The Queen officially revokes it - which hasnapost yet happened.For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. Dr Prescott said: That Prince Andrew will neverto public le is implicit in the palace’s statement, as all patronages and military positions will revert back to the Queen. Given the Queen’s age, she will likely redistribute them to other members of the royal family. This decision is similar to the one reached with Prince Harry and the Duchess of Sussex in , when they stepped back from their roles as senior royals. Then, the Queen announced that her grandson and his we would no longer use the HRH title. Andrew is now in the same position, though for quite dferent reasons. Formally, all three retain the HRH title, but will not use it in official capacity.  The dficulty for the Queen is that both Prince Harry and Prince Andrew are entitled to retain the title under Letters Patent issued by George V in  - this is a legal document that effectively expresses the wishes of the monarch. King George V wanted a aposslimmed down monarchyapos, so issued a new law - Letters Patent. This limited the number of royal relatives that could use the title of Prince or Princess. This means that only the children and grandchildren of the monarch through the male line are automatically given the title, plus the first son of the eldest son of the Prince of Wales.  Dr Prescott continued: It would take a further Letters Patent for a HRH title to be removed from someone. In  this happened with Diana, Princess of Wales, following her orce with Prince Charles. This was enormously controversial at the time, but it shows that it is possible for someone to formally lose their HRH title. Still, Andrew has not lost everything. He retains the title of aposprinceapos from birth and remains the Duke of York, which is a peerage. Under the law, both titles and peerages are forms of intangible property . A general principle of law is that property cannot simply be seized from someone without prior legal authorisation. He also remains in the line of succession for the throne.  Looking to the future, when Andrew dies, the dukedom will die with him, as he leaves no male heir. Traditionally, the peerage would go to the second eldest son of the monarch . Andrew also retains the position of Councillor of State. Should the Queen be unable to fulfil her formal legal duties due to illness, Councillors of State can fulfil those duties on her behalf. This is provided for by the Regency Acts  to , which specy that the first four in the line of succession of full age , are appointed as Councillors. That currently means Prince Charles, Prince William, Prince Harry and Prince Andrew. Two are expected to act together, whichrequired, would be Prince Charles and Prince William. Again, for this to change, an act of parliament would be required.There are other problems with the Regency Acts, making reform more likely in the near future, especially when Prince Charles becomes King. This would create the opportunity to more thoroughly address the position of both Prince Harry and Prince Andrew.The dukedom and Andrew’s position as a Councillor of State mean that the separation of Prince Andrew from royal le is not entirely complete, but it is as far as the Queen can go for now. The rest is up to Parliament.Do you have a story to share  Weaposd love to hear all about it. news uk-news prince-andrew-spotted-fergie-first-"Prince Andrew stripped of military titles and royal patronagesByKelly-Ann MillsNews Reporter:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan Prince Andrew and ex-we Sarah Ferguson have been spotted together for the first time since he was stripped of his royal and military titles by the Queen. The former married couple who remain close despite their orce in , were seen driving from Royal Lodge, his residence in the grounds of Windsor Great Park in Berkshire. The Queen decided to strip her son of his titles as the legal case being brought by Virginia Gufre over sexual assault allegations presses on in New York. Earlier in the week more than  war veterans had written a strongly-worded public letter to the Queen calling for her to strip her son of his titles. The service personnel, who said they were proud to fight for their country, said it would be inconceivable he would remain in postit were any other senior military officer.  The letter read: Officers of the British armed forces must adhere to the very highest standards of ...honourable conduct. These are standards which Prince Andrew has fallen well short of. We are therefore asking that you take immediate steps to strip Prince Andrew of all his military ranks and titles. We understand that he is your son, but we write to you in your capacity as head of state and as Commander-in-Chief of the Army, Navy and Air Force.  This week Her Majesty did strip her son of his military titles and royal patronages and said he can no longer use the title His Royal Highness. Royal expert Duncan Larcombe told OK! that the Queen will be frustrated with how the situation has been handled, especially on the year of her Diamond Jubilee.Mr Larcombe said: As a mother, this is the stuff of nightmares.The Queen on her Jubilee year, is being hit by this double whammy effect of trouble for the firm and trouble for the family. She has spent so many years building the reputation, and then suddenly it comes out. The Epstein thing has been under the surface for a decade, but it’s now exploded. It’s one disaster after the other.  It has been reported that Sarah Ferguson has no plans to ditch her Duchess title despite Andrew being stripped of his HRH. Friends of Sarah told the Daily Mail she had held the title of duchess since her orce from Andrew and “that is how it will stay”. Andrew is still the Duke of York, so it is not an issue,” they said.Follow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON The QueenSarah FergusonPrince Andrew, Duke of YorkRoyal Family" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news prince-andrew-would-scream-maids-"Prince Andrew stripped of military titles and royal patronagesByRyan FaheyNews Reporter:,  Jan Prince Andrew would fly into a tantrum and shout and screamhis teddy bear collection was knocked out of place by royal servants, a former royal cop claims.Ex-protection officer Paul Page revealed a heap of intimate anecdotes about the Queenaposs second son in an interview with Ranvir Singh for ITVaposs Ghislaine, Prince Andrew and the Paedophile.Page worked in Royalty and Specialist Protection Command between  and  and had access to the princeaposs private quarters. In this apartment, the Duke of York had a bed piled high with stuffed animals and toys, Page claims. He said: “It had about  or  stuffed toys positioned on the bed and basically there was a card the inspector showed us in a drawer and it was a picture of these bears all in situ. “The reason for the laminated picture wasthose bears weren’t put back in the right order by the maids, he would shout and scream.” One royal writer was introduced to the strange collection at Buckingham Palace in .  Elizabeth Day said of the bizarre meeting: It seemed rather strange that a grown man should be so amused by a stuffed toy.” The new show - Ghislaine, Prince Andrew and the Paedophile - is being aired on ITV on Tuesday at pm. In the programme, ITV says Singh unravels the story of how an entitled daughter of a billionaire sank into shame and disgrace through her friendship with paedophile Jeffrey Epstein. It will also explore how Prince Andrew, the Queenaposs second son, is now embroiled in the scandal as he faces his own possible civil court case brought by Virginia Giuffre Andrew has strenuously denied the allegations made by Ms Giuffre against him.  Page also recalled suspecting that Andrew and pimp Ghislaine were lovers because she would come and go from his quarters at will.Page, who is not without scandal himself after being jailed for a £million fraud scam in , said Ghislaine and Andrewaposs other female friends rarely signed in, The Sun Online reports.Again, speaking with Singh, Page said: “From the way she was allowed to enter and exit the palace at will, we suspected that she may have had an intimate relationship with Prince Andrew.”  He continued: “She kept coming in and out, in and out.” It comes after reports claimed Prince Andrew was tearful when the Queen told him she was stripping him of his honorary military titles. The Duke of York was said to be utterly devastated by his mother’s bombshell decision. The move came after a US judge ruled a civil case in New York against Andrew by his sex accuser Ms Giuffre can go ahead. Andrew strenuously denies any wrongdoing. The princeaposs lawyers want to quiz Ms Giuffreaposs psychologist to seehis accuser is suffering from  memories of meeting him.  It was quickly ridiculed by legal experts who described it as a “typical tactic” used in historic sexual abuse cases, and one Ghislaine Maxwell used at her trial. But Andrew’s lawyers are determined to grill Ms Giuffre’s therapist Dr Judith Lightfoot on the “theory of  memories” as well as matters discussed during their sessions, notes taken and any prescriptions given. The lawyers state that the royal “contends that [Ms Giuffre] may suffer from  memories, as evidenced by the fact that her claims regarding her time with Epstein, and the circumstances under which [Prince Andrew] allegedly assaulted her, have repeatedly changed over the years”.Follow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON Prince Andrew, Duke of YorkITVBuckingham PalaceDocumentariesRoyal FamilyToysGhislaine MaxwellJeffrey Epstein" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: prince harry offered pay security
story: Prince Harry offered to pay for his own security while in the UK but was refusedPrince Harry has threatened the Home Office with pursuing a judicial reviewhe and his family arent provided full and continued security while visiting the UK. It comes after his petition to self-fund his personal protection was "dismissed", his lawyers claimPrince Harry has offered to pay for his own security while in the UK, according to his lawyersBySophie Wingate, PARyan FaheyNews Reporter:,  Jan | commentsPrince Harryaposs offer to pay for his own police protection while in the UK was dismissed by the Home Office, his lawyers claim.The Duke of Sussex has threatened to pursue a judicial review against a decision made by the Home Officethe Government does not provide continued security while he and his family are in the country.In a statement, the duke also made clear he is happy to pay for officers - an offer which has been dismissed, according to a Mail on Sunday investigation.In a statement from the Princeaposs lawyers, he insists on the self-funded protection so his family does not impose on the British taxpayer. He first offered to pay for his own security detail in January  at Sandringham. But this current legal action, which began in September last year, stems from his July  visit to the UK for the unveiling of a statue of his late mum, Princess Diana.While the prince was not provided security on this occasion, he was protected just months earlier when he visited to attend the funeral of his granddad, Prince Philip.  In a statement from Harryaposs lawyers, he claims the lack of continuity means the prince and his family are unable tohome. And his simple goal is to ensure the safety of his kids so they can know his home country.The statement adds: The UK will always be Prince Harry ’s home and a country he wants his we and children to be safe in.With the lack of police protection, comes too great a personal risk. The prince also hopes his petition for the review - and after pleading with the Home Office for security - will resolve this situation.  The statement also gives further detail of the nature of Harryaposs inherited security risk, which he carries for le. He remains sixth in line to the throne, served two tours of combat duty in Afghanistan, and in recent years his family has been subjected to well-documented neo-Nazi and extremist threats, it says. While his role within the institution has changed, his profile as a member of the Royal Family has not. Nor has the threat to him and his family.  Through his lawyers, the prince also pointed to other high-profile figures with an inherent threat risk who receive free police protection after leaving public office. Responding to the news of Harryaposs case, a Government spokesperson said: “The UK Government’s protective security system is rigorous and proportionate. It is our long-standing policy not to provide detailed information on those arrangements. To do so could compromise their integrity and affect iniduals’ security. “It would also not be appropriate to comment on the detail of any legal proceedings.”  A judicial review is a type of court case in which a claimant challenges the lawfulness of a decision made by a public body or government department, such as the Home Office, according to the Judiciary UK website. A judge reviews the way in which a decision has been made. The court is not really concerned with the conclusions of that process and whether they were right or wrong, as long as the right procedures have been followed. The court will not re-make the decision. If the claimant wins, the decision can be declared unlawful, or quashed. That will usually mean the decision has to be taken again. While the public body could reach the same decision again, it may follow a proper procedure that leads to a dferent decision result. news uk-news prince-harry-says-lack-security-"Prince Harry files claim over police protection for familyByDave BurkeSenior News Reporter:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | commentsPrince Harry says he is unable to bring we Meghan and their two children to the UK due to a lack of security.The -year-old, who remains sixth in line to the throne despite quitting royal duties in , has threatened legal action against the Home Office.He is said to be keen to bring son Archie and daughter Lilibet to visit his homeland, but claims he is unable to do so. Megan and Archie have not ed to the UK since the couple walked away from royal le in , while Lilibet has yet to set foot in the country where her dad was born. Lawyers acting for the Duke of Sussex say they will seek a judicial reviewcontinued security is not provided when he and his family visit. In a statement his legal team said Harryaposs security was compromised last summer when he unveiled a statue of his mother, Princess Diana, at Kensington Palace. It said that Harry - who inherited a security threat at birth - is unable toto his home with his family, saying they have been subjected to well-documented neo-Nazi and extremist threats. Without police protection, lawyers said, bringing Meghan and the children over comes at too great a personal risk. The Duke has ed to the UK twice in the last two years - for the statue unveiling in July last year and Prince Philipaposs funeral three months earlier - but Meghan and the children have stayed in the US both times. Harry is arguing his private protection team in the US does not have adequate jurisdiction abroad or access to UK intelligence information which is needed keep the Sussex family safe.  The UK will always be Prince Harryaposs home and a country he wants his we and children to be safe in, the statement said. The Duke has filed a claim for a judicial review against a Home Office decision not to allow him to personally pay for police protection while in the UK. His representatives said British taxpayers will not have to foot the bill, but said a private security team cannot replicate the protection needed.  It added that he had first offered to pay for police protection for himself and his family in January , but the offer was not accepted. During last summeraposs visit to London, Harryaposs car was chased by photographers - an incident that has made him anxious about his safety. A source told the Mail on Sunday: aposHarryaposs argument in a nutshell is: aposYou got the law wrong.apos He feels the decision to remove his security was wrong. Pre-action protocol was sent by Harryaposs lawyers to the Home Office a couple of months ago. This is essentially a precursor to a judicial review. If the case goes forward it could lead to a legal battle in the High Court between Government ministers and the Duke.  The statement in full Prince Harry inherited a security risk at birth, for le. He remains sixth in line to the throne, served two tours of combat duty in Afghanistan, and in recent years his family has been subjected to well-documented neo-Nazi and extremist threats. While his role within the institution has changed, his profile as a member of the royal family has not. Nor has the threat to him and his family.The Duke and Duchess of Sussex personally fund a private security team for their family, yet that security cannot replicate the necessary police protection needed whilst in the UK. In the absence of such protection, Prince Harry and his family are unable toto his home.The duke first offered to pay personally for UK police protection for himself and his family in January of  at Sandringham. That offer was dismissed. He remains willing to cover the cost of security, as not to impose on the British taxpayer. As is widely known, others who have left public office and have an inherent threat risk receive police protection at no cost to them. The goal for Prince Harry has been simple - to ensure the safety of himself and his family while in the UK so his children can know his home country.  During his last visit to the UK in July  - to unveil a statue in honour of his late mother - his security was compromised due to the absence of police protection, whilst leaving a charity event. After another attempt at negotiations was also rejected, he sought a judicial review in September  to challenge the decision-making behind the security procedures, in the hopes that this could be re-evaluated for the obvious and necessary protection required. The UK will always be Prince Harryaposs home and a country he wants his we and children to be safe in. With the lack of police protection, comes too great a personal risk. Prince Harry hopes that his petition - after close to two years of pleas for security in the UK - will resolve this situation. It is due to a leak in a UK tabloid, with surreptitious timing, we feel it necessary to release a statement setting the facts straight. title: pubs called duke york considering
story: Pubs called Duke of York considering name change to avoid link to Prince AndrewThis week the Queen stripped her second son Prince Andrew of all of his military titles and he has also been stopped from using the His Royal Highness titleDuke of York Pub in Fitzrovia Image: Alamy Stock PhotoByKelly-Ann MillsNews Reporter:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan Landlords are considering whether to change the name of their Duke of York pubs across the country to avoid links to Prince Andrew. The Queenaposs son is facing a civil case in the US accused of sexually assaulting Virginia Gufre when she was just , a claim he vehemently denies. This week Her Majesty stripped Prince Andrew of all of his military titles and His Royal Highness title. And now, pubs across the UK are considering whether their establishments should get rebranded. But punter Lawrence Ockleford said: ‘It’s only a title. Obviously what he has been accused of is not good, but you can’t really erase the history.  I think you shouldn’t glory him as a person but it’s OK to keep the names. George Cork, the general manager of The Duke of York pub in Southwark, London said he would not be changing the name of his pub. There’s no plans to change the name.  The Duke of York has been called The Duke of York for a long time now – it’s about a title and the original Duke of York from the s. Everyone’s entitled to their opinion, but he’s not affiliated with us in any way. The pub’s been around for a long time and there are  pubs around the UK that probably feel the same way. The Duke of York pub in Fitzrovia has one of the clearest ties to Andrew, with a large portrait of Andrew on the outside and on its signage. news uk-news scientists-list-new-omicron-symptoms-"What are the symptoms of the Omicron Variant of Covid ByAaliyah RuggGraeme Murray:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan  As new iants of Covid emerge during the panic, people can easily become confused whether they have Omicron or simply a common cold. Three main symptoms of coronavirus are listed by the NHS as a high temperature, a new, continuous cough and a loss or change to your sense of smell and taste.But scientists behind the ZOE Covid symptom app claim others testing positive for Omicron are now reporting symptoms more like a common cold. Scientists took health reports from contributors reporting positive cases in the ZOE COVID Study app in December  as Omicron became dominant They then compared them with data from early October when Delta was the dominant iant. The Liverpool Echo reports Dr Claire Steves found the top five symptoms in both periods were: Runny nose Headache Fatigue Sneezing Sore throatThe analysis found no clear dference in the symptom profile of Delta and Omicron, with only % of people experiencing the classic three symptoms of fever, cough, or loss of sense of smell or taste. The typical symptoms of a cough, loss of taste and smell and fever, were further down on the list. Other symptoms in order included:Persistent cough Hoarse voice Other Shivers Fever Dizzy Brain fog Altered smell Eye sorenessUnusual muscle pains Skipped meals Loss of smell Chest pains Swollen glands Feeling downLoss of smell and taste become much less common. It was in the top  symptoms earlier in , and now itaposs ranking at , with only one in five people experiencing it. Dr Steves said cold-like symptoms remain the top symptoms in people with covid and classic symptoms such as a cough are much less prevalent. She added: Most reported symptoms are really very much like a cold, especially in people who have been vaccinated. If you are feeling at all under the weather please make sure you get a test. If the symptoms are mild, why should I worry about Omicron Omicron can still hospitalise and cause serious illness and can spread much quicker, scientists say, as well as having damaging effects on the economy due to high numbers of people needing to self-isolate. According to ZOE research, findings show exactly what you can do to strengthen your immune system — like eating a healthy - and to help protect yourself against coronavirus and other harmful invaders. In detail, the study found that people who ate a high-quality diet, rich in plant-based foods, were  per cent less likely to get Covid- and  per cent less likely to get severe illness requiring treatment in the hospital.Additionally, being fully vaccinated has been found to be the best way to protect people from severe disease and hospitalisation as well as mask wearing in crowded places.
